data.title: Nothing special
data.text: We had breakfast here on a weekday. Thought the prices were a little high and the gravy is from a mix with no sausage. A slice of country ham $6.99??

data.title: Always a good meal
data.text: This restaurant is opened for breakfast and lunch.  They do have daily specials and serve lunch buffet style.  I believe you can also order off a menu, however.  I was there for breakfast twice in the past 2 weeks and both times the breakfast was served as ordered.  The food was fresh, eggs cooked as ordered, and not too greasy.  The restaurant is good sized and open concept, so it can get quite loud in there at times.  Also, while there is limited street parking, you can park in the back of the restaurant and come in beside the kitchen (from the back).  I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a fresh, hot, cooked meal.

data.title: I know why they are so busy!
data.text: We went to Bob's for lunch on Sunday.  Not much open on Sunday for lunch in Conway.  It was a delicious accident.  We walked in just behind the lunch rush so we did have to wait a while for our food but the waitress told us immediately how long it would be so we set back and people watched.  There was a constant flow of folks coming in for lunch.  Vey obvious it is a local favorite.  Servers were always stopping by to see if we needed more to drink or wanted something.  The food was very good and I only wished we could have gone back a second time.

data.title: Busy Cafeteria!
data.text: There are not many breakfast restaurants in Conway. Everyone goes here, all the locals! Service is excellent. Food is a little average, but served hot and fresh! Eggs done to perfection, and hot fluffy bisquits! This restaurant is very large and employs alot of people. They serve breakfast from 5 a m to 2 p m when they close. Lunch 11 to 2 p m.

data.title: Best breakfast joint in Conway
data.text: This place has been around for ages.  Good food, good value. Usually great service, by someone who has been there a long time. Love that.

data.title: Iconic Downtown Conway Eatery
data.text: The food wasn't awesome or terrible. Hash browns were very greasy. I'm vegetarian, so I can't comment on meat selection.

data.title: Breakfast
data.text: Food was hot and fresh. The wait staff was almost a little to friendly! Don't like waitress being in my personal space. That is just me though. Food was good, prices weren't bad either.

data.title: Home town place
data.text:
This is one of those places that only the locals know about so you know it's good. They serve breakfast all day and lunches are home cooked southern food. I've always loved everything. The servers are very friendly and always check in to see if we need anything. (My friends and I stay here for quite a while each visit)
It's one of my favorites.

data.title: Been going here since I was a kid!
data.text: This downtown place is standing the test of time.  Great Mom & Pop place with breakfast, brunch & dinner selections for anyone seeking home cooking for cheap.

data.title: Awesome
data.text: This place is so good, staff in all areas is great the food is great, they def care about their customers if something isn't right they do their best to fix it, everything is made to order!

data.title: LOVE this Place
data.text: We try to eat here every visit to Conway.  The staff is extremely friendly and helpful.  The food is delicious.  I recommend Bobs to everyone who visit's Conway.  It's downtown.

data.title: Best place in town for breakfast and lunch!
data.text: Visiting for antiquing and were at a loss for breakfast and asked a local. He said "go downtown to Bobs". Well, that we did! No wait but definitely a full house. Immediate service and drinks came out quickly. All the waitresses shared the load of serving and tips which led to a very efficient service and hot food. My husband didn't bring his glasses so our waitress handed him hers and said see you later. WOW!!! Who does that? I am ashamed to tell you what we ate but were just plain enthralled with everything! We had hot links, french toast, cheese omelet made with real cheddar, and pancakes! All were just perfect but the bread used on the french toast was not to my liking but it was delicious to everyone else from the looks of the plates. Pancakes light and almost liking eating cake. Oh, the bill was sooo cheap. If you are traveling this way, take the time to stop. The lunches are massive and start cafeteria style. $9.99 will get you a choice of 4 vegies and specials of the day. How can they survive acting this way? Will go see, it is a MUST!!!

data.title: Best breakfast in town
data.text: Amazing little diner. Breakfast is absolutely delicious. The grits are served with butter just like they should be! The service is excellent, all the waitresses help each other out and any of them can get anything you need to go with your meal. Absolutely a gem!

data.title: Breakfast tradition
data.text: We had a traditional breakfast here and it was good.  The biscuits were very fluffy and the the cream gravy was tasty!  Next time I would try the hash brown specials.

data.title: Old Time Diner Atmosphere
data.text: Love an old timey diner, with home cooking, located in downtown area. This place is quite large, with parking on the street, or at the rear of the building. Seat yourself, choose a table or booth. Waitress was with us right away, and brought coffee, which she kept filled. I had a veggie omelet with rye toast. It was quite a wait for the food to come even though the place was not half full, but the food was hot and filling. Had a nice picante sauce on the table that went well with the omelet. Place is a bit noisy, so choose your seat carefully.

data.title: My favorite place
data.text: Awesome place lots of local charm & local customs . This is the "cheers " of local diners . Here everyone knows your name

data.title: Local Favorite!!
data.text: If you want to eat like the locals, head to Bob's Grill. Amazing, home-style food, friendly waitresses and daily specials. Great old-fashioned diner with the best breakfasts in Conway (if you have little ones, ask for a Minnie Mouse pancake!!)

data.title: The "Don't miss" in Conway, AR
data.text: I always love a small diner downtown in the heart of a growing city. Bob's did not disappoint! I tried their Sunday special, Fried Chicken and I haven't eaten fried checked anywhere else since then. The staff makes you feel like family, the food makes it feel like home, and the prices will leave you with enough left to come back for breakfast the next morning! If you are in Conway, AR, you do not want to miss out on Bob's!!

data.title: Old fashioned diner food
data.text: Bob's is one of the go-to places for breakfast.  It is always busy, and you often sit at community tables. The food is good, and a great value.  Just don't go expecting anything fancy ... this isn't that kind of place.

data.title: Do You Like Mom & Pops?
data.text: Homestyle cooking, great breakfasts, and best of all...crushed ice for the soft drinks! Why don't other places realize the crushed ice lovers following?!!
